name: sfchronicle
text: The number of coronavirus cases in the U.S. topped 4 million on Thursday evening, reaching another grim milestone as California and other states cope with surges, according to Johns Hopkins University. The country has recorded 144,242 deaths from COVID-19. https://t.co/iV6ANGppzR

name: sfchronicle
text: Some likely possibilities are somber: Companies will close. Dancers will end their already brief careers early or leave the field prematurely. Audiences and budgets will shrink, even in a still wary post-pandemic era. https://t.co/aQTMSCwHsL

name: sfchronicle
text: An additional 1.4 million Americans filed for unemployment last week, just as the benefits they can receive are about to be slashed, deepening the humanitarian and economic crises stemming from the pandemic. https://t.co/lgL58HSgow https://t.co/G5Xjx6uNYq
